content.rendered:
Newborn Care Jobs for New York’s Savviest Specialists

As a Newborn Care Specialist, you fulfill a very special role in homes: you are a “baby whisperer” who provides expert care and developmental support in the precious first weeks and months. You are the essential professional who helps families comfortably transition into parenthood.

Apply Today

Unconditional love with unconditional support.

Our approach seeks to match you with families where values and care styles align. At this precious and intimate time, they seek support and understanding from professionals who can offer guidance and knowledge, while setting them up to be confident and successful parents.

Why NbN?

Support for professionals, by professionals:

  • Access to New York’s top NCS and Night Nanny opportunities
  • A variety of terms and schedules are available to suit your needs
  • Respect for your experience, knowledge, input and time
  • Representation from leading industry experts
  • Support with interview tips, interview questions, resume creation, and resources for continued higher learning
  • Work agreements that include benefits and living arrangements that meet your requirements
  • An advocate for legal compliance and fair compensation
    Support throughout your placement
Find Your Family
View Positions

THE NbN NEWBORN CARE SPECIALIST

Why Join Our NbN Network?

We know you’re great at what you do and have many choices on how to manage your career. Here are some of the reasons New York City’s savviest nannies choose Nannies by Noa:

Meet Great Families: Our families are the best – we create personal relationships based on respect, value, and collaboration.

Shift Flexibility: We provide families options for 12-hour day, 12-hour night, and 24-hour full-day support, so you can choose the role best suited to you.

We're Always Here For You: Focus on your newborn care mission, with professional support that's always working to make it easier for you.

Easier Placements: From finding your perfect family to managing every placement process, we make it easier and more rewarding for you.

Strong Advocates: Make better and more confident decisions about your role, priorities, and compensation with our team on your side.

Diligent Negotiators: Enjoy compensation and benefits that are fully aligned with your experience, role, and career happiness.

Professional Development: Enjoy support to grow your career in the childcare profession and unlock more opportunities.

No Compromises, No Skipped Steps

Nannies by Noa specializes in personalized placements and we pride ourselves in attracting the best families in the region. Our approach ensures that you are not only comfortable in your Newborn Care Specialist role but fully integrated within your family as a trusted and respected team member.

Find Your Family

What Our Nannies Are Saying...

Nannies by Noa is a wonderful agency to work with…
I felt confident that they were doing their due diligence in finding the jobs that were the best fit for me. I can definitely tell that they respect nannies and the industry, and advocate for the nannies during the process.Ticiana R. | Nanny
I felt encouraged and represented by the staff…
The communication was fantastic. Any time I had a question I felt comfortable emailing and they always responded quickly. They truly care about both the families and the Nannie’s.Jennifer C. | Nanny
I can confidently say I trust Nannies by Noa...
NbN has been nothing but kind and welcoming. I definitely recommend to any family stressed in the searching process and are looking to hire asap for a top-notch nanny.Inesa S. | Nanny
It’s been an immense pleasure working with NbN…
They worked diligently to match me with the perfect family. I’m currently working with a lovely family and I couldn’t have done it without NbN’s patience, support and understanding.Vanessa V. | Nanny
Nannies by Noa is an incredibly organized and wonderful company...
I applied to be a nanny there, and each round of interviews was warm, kind, and helpful. They take their vetting process very seriously which made me feel confident I'd be matched with the perfect family.Lilly S. | Nanny
I am SO happy in my new position…
I am so grateful to NbN for helping me find my new family. I appreciate the process that Nannies by Noa put me through. It went into great depth and was very professional.Kimmie W. | Nanny
You've found the best agency in the city!
From the moment of my initial contact, I realized this was an exceptional agency to work with. NbN has raised the industry standard by which all others should follow.Matt S. | Nanny
NbN is the best agency I’ve worked with…
They really took the time to help me through the application process and make sure I would be connected with a great family. They go above and beyond. Love them!Mariety O. | Nanny
Find a family that is the best fit for you…
This agency truly cares about their nannies as individuals. They are friendly, personable, super competent, and they make sure that nannies and families are both happy. I felt truly supported by every step of the way.Kayla Y. | Nanny
This is the best Nanny agency in New York City…
They will assist you during the hiring process, and are very open and helpful. When a family offered me a position, NbN helped in negotiating everything, making sure that I will be happy and will receive fair compensation.May F. | Nanny

Our Application Process in a New York Minute

01

First, complete an application.

Share your experience, training, and certifications, and also let us know about the opportunities you are looking for – now is a great time to tell us about your dream family and job.

02

Next, we have a discovery call.

This is a chance for us to get acquainted and find out if we could be a great match. We want to learn more about you, including your qualifications and background information.

03

Then, let's learn more.

Tell us firsthand who you are as a caregiver and the position you will thrive in. Ask questions and learn about the value of joining our network for your next NCS search.

04

We’ll connect with your references.

Referring NCS to families is a big responsibility that we take seriously. Learning about your caregiving approach helps us understand what strengths and special gifts you offer.

Joining Our Network

Acceptance is reserved for the most capable, compassionate, and qualified applicants. Newborn Care is the most intimate role and requires an understanding of family dynamics and discretion like no other. Do you have what it takes?

Find Your Family
View Positions

What’s an NbN Newborn Care Specialist?

On average, only the top 2% of applicants are accepted into our network. That means our newborn care specialists are the most qualified and well-vetted childcare professionals in the New York and Tri-State area. Our assessment process extends far beyond the typical background check because we believe that it’s more than years on the job that makes you a standout professional!

Our standards of care for all applicants include:

  • Authorization to work in the United States.
  • High-level knowledge and proficiency of best practices in newborn care.
  • A minimum of 3000 hours or 3 years of cumulative experience with newborns, working in private homes.
  • NCS training and/or certification.
  • Infant CPR and First Aid.
  • A well-suited demeanor for gently supporting new parents.
  • Exceptional references which attest to a high level of skill and autonomy in working with newborns.
  • A clean background. Criminal records checked through a federal level.
  • A polished and professional appearance.
  • Fluency in both oral and written English and email proficiency.
  • Communication assessment.

NCS with enhanced qualifications are also sought after, including…

  • CACHE accreditation.
  • Doula/NICU or nursing experience.
  • Lacation and sleep counselor training.
  • New parent educator training or other post-partum coursework.
  • Experience with twins and higher order multiples.
  • CPST- Child Passenger Safety Training.
  • Experience supporting culturally diverse families.
  • Four-year accredited university degree and beyond.
  • Flexible schedule & ability to travel.
  • Fluency in additional languages.

*We reserve the right to discontinue an application at any time and an interview does not guarantee an invitation into our network of nannies.

Find Your Family
View Positions

Childcare is full of questions…

Thankfully, we have some of the answers.

Why should I apply to your agency?

Our matchmaking works because we consider the needs of all parties involved. Our clients understand the tremendous rewards of hiring a skilled Newborn Care Specialist to guide their child’s formative months. We want to get to know you too, so we can not only accurately convey the skills you offer, but so that we understand with which family dynamic you’ll thrive and feel the greatest reward.

What do you look for in an NCS applicant?

Our NCS must adhere not only to our standards but also to the recommended practices set by the International Nanny Association (INA) the umbrella organization of the in-home childcare industry.

Please see the INA’s ‘Standards of care for all applicants’.

Where do you place NCS?

Our client families are predominantly based in NYC and the surrounding Tri-State areas.

I don't currently live in NY or the Tri-State area, can I still apply? What if I'm looking for a live-in position, can I still apply?

NCS are the exception and may apply from outside our service area for opportunities seeking ‘24’s’ (round the clock coverage). Many NYC families have limited space to house those from out of state when seeking 12 hr. day or night shifts, in which instance, NCS candidates with their own local housing generally offer the most appeal.

What are the hourly rates in NYC?

Rates vary based on experience and education. Currently, we see hourly rates between

$40-$50+ for skilled and trained NCS.

Why wasn't I accepted into your network?

There are many reasons why we’re unable to proceed with an application. A variety of factors are considered such as a candidate’s location, availability, prior experience, longevity, reference quality, and compensation hopes. Professionalism is assessed throughout our process, and we reserve the right to discontinue representation at any time throughout the application process and beyond. Only a small percentage of applicants are accepted into our network for these and other reasons. We do not share references with you or disclose any information provided by your former employees with you.

I've been babysitting since high school and worked in a daycare center and a summer camp - can I apply for a nanny job?

While this is great experience, we seek career-minded nannies with a desire to work in the field long-term and who have previously provided a full spectrum of private in-home care with a minimum of 5 years of experience. Applicants must have references that speak to a broad knowledge of child development and experience with related tasks such as children’s housekeeping, meal preparation, and laundry.

I got my newborn care certificate online but haven’t actually worked with newborns yet. Can I apply?

Congratulations on continuing your education. Knowledge of best practices is critical in the role of an NCS. Of course, your hands-on experience is equally important; therefore, we seek a minimum of 3000 hours or 3 years of cumulative experience with newborns for representation.

I have great letters of recommendation, but my employers aren't available to speak to you, can I still apply?

Our vetting process requires speaking with a minimum of three prior employers in recent NCS positions. Supporting letters of recommendation are wonderful and we encourage you to include them in your profile.

Do you have families that will pay 'under the table'?

We strongly advocate for legal pay for all Childcare professionals. Our client families agree to adhere to all state & local tax and labor laws. To learn why legal pay matters and the benefits it provides you, click here.

One-of-a-kind newborn care for one-of-a-kind families.

Dynamic opportunities, each as unique and diverse as the people needed to fill them.

Find Your Family
View Positions
